eae9c13b-9848-40df-9ad0-8c5cd704d372.description: Offered by the Center for Educational Innovation (UB CEI), the earner of this badge is able to identify situational and personal factors that affect instruction, develop a personal teaching and learning philosophy, apply backward and integrated design theories to a course, analyze and create learning outcomes using frameworks, create rubrics to provide consistent feedback, and align assessments and activities to learning outcomes.
eae9c13b-9848-40df-9ad0-8c5cd704d372.name: Designing Experiences Academy

issuer.summary: issued by University at Buffalo, Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a Course Planning Sheet, an Assessment Rubric and a Teaching and Learning Philosophy statement.

1227582c-5a2a-4a0a-92ae-e83796df71a6.description: Offered by the Center for Educational Innovation (UB CEI), the earner of this badge has demonstrated the ability to create a positive community climate, apply active learning techniques to create effective experiences, design and maintain group collaboration, apply Universal Design for Learning (UDL) guidelines to support an inclusive classroom, incorporate meaningful feedback and formative assessment, and apply scaffolding techniques to a course design.
1227582c-5a2a-4a0a-92ae-e83796df71a6.name: Teaching Effectively Academy

issuer.summary: issued by University at Buffalo, Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Submit a lesson that incorporates a variety of activities (jigsaw, group, discussions, feedback level, scaffolding, etc.) and teaching methods (flipped classroom, interactive lecture, guided instruction, etc.). Apply Universal Design for Learning (UDL) principles to a  lesson.

b5ff55be-8ce5-4331-a9e1-9b8088ef9033.description: Offered by the Center for Educational Innovation (UB CEI), the earner of this badge has demonstrated the ability to create reflective artifacts through the application of scientific learning framework theory. The resulting artifacts align with candidate checklist items found in UB's Promotion Dossier and will display in an ePortfolio created in the Digication platform.
b5ff55be-8ce5-4331-a9e1-9b8088ef9033.name: Learning Paradigms Academy

issuer.summary: issued by University at Buffalo, Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Create three of the following: Lesson incorporating a PowerPoint presentation (specifically focused on learning objective 1-3); Self-assessment or pre-assessment;  Conceptual Change Activity; Copy of an updated syllabus; Growth Mindset Plan; Student Reflection Plan and Activity (Parts 3 & 4) and a Concept Map.

9dee49f5-a3fd-4ebf-8d5e-7f69a6fe66aa.description: This academy focuses on preparing faculty for online teaching with the application of the backwards design theory framework to a new or existing course. Focus on a specific principle of course alignment; course design, course framework, content creation, and student interaction.
9dee49f5-a3fd-4ebf-8d5e-7f69a6fe66aa.name: Designing and Building Online Courses

issuer.summary: issued by University at Buffalo, Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Participants are required to complete and submit a course alignment planning sheet. The Course Planning Sheet will include the course learning outcomes, along with which taxonomy (Bloom's or Fink's) and which taxonomy level will be used to reach the learning outcome. Participants will identify the readings/resources, what teaching methods used in class, as well as the intended learning activities and finally the assignments needed to reach each of the course learning outcomes.

Participants will create one learning module with a variety of content and interactions. Participants will be guided by a learning module checklist of items recommended to include in their online course composition.
Participants will create a student course orientation module. Participants will be guided by a course orientation module checklist of items recommended to include in their online course composition.

Participants will be asked to record a course tour video of their online course. This video walks users through where and how to find important components within their online course design. Some items to locate are: the course include a welcome message as well as looking at overall layout and design of their online course. Easy to find course items along with user-friendly course navigation.

97f381c3-c136-4539-8f37-fd800d7f9be6.description: This academy focuses on preparing faculty to effectively lead, evaluate and facilitate a high-quality online course through the use of research-based evaluation tools for quality and creation of a community of inquiry to improve student success.
97f381c3-c136-4539-8f37-fd800d7f9be6.name: Evaluating and Facilitating Online Courses

issuer.summary: issued by University at Buffalo, Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Participants will submit a self-score (or peer review) of their course utilizing the Open SUNY OSCQR rubric. The OSCQR Rubric consists of 50 items suggested to include in their online course design.
Participants will submit an action plan for improvement to their course based on the OSCQR Rubric. This can be done on OSCQR rubric or alternative action plan template.

Participants will submit a reflection with guiding questions. Participants are asked to created a reflection of their online course building experience. The reflection can be submitted as a video or written format to be reviewed by a Learning Designer.

skills.name: Assess Student Work Using OSQCR Rubric

673ad68e-50bb-4a21-9312-652e129578ec.description: Offered by the University Libraries, this program provides faculty members an opportunity to gain competencies in scholarly publishing. Badge earners are able to: Prepare a manuscript or proposal for publication or funding; Create an ORCiD (a persistent digital identifier); make plans to protect their intellectual property; Understand the rationale behind protecting their data; Comply with IRB protocol policies and procedures.
673ad68e-50bb-4a21-9312-652e129578ec.name: Scholarly Publishing for Faculty

issuer.summary: issued by University at Buffalo, Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Attend weekly instruction or lectures three times a month for three months; Create an ORCi; Draft a data management plan or complete UB CITI or Click training; Provide a grant, conference presentation, or publication abstract.

60284dcf-559e-4632-92bc-a544ad95f637.description: Offered by the CTSI, recipients of this badge have gained comprehensive training designed to help them reach intellectual and research independence as clinical and translational researchers. Badge earners complete courses in ethics and clinical & translational research, as well as attend Workshops and Seminar series developed as part of the K-Scholar Program and selected Core Competency Workshop series presented by CTSI.
60284dcf-559e-4632-92bc-a544ad95f637.name: CTSI K Scholars Translational Research Readiness

issuer.summary: issued by University at Buffalo, Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: RESPONSIBLE CONDUCT OF RESEARCH (RCR) Learning Objectives: 1. Define and understand the definition and principles of RCR according to NIH guidelines for instruction and subject matter 2. Develop strategies for the practical application of RCR knowledge to prevent research misconduct. Course Components CITI: RCR, HSR, GCP, IACUC (as applicable) and Responsible Conduct of Research Core Competency Series (6 workshops)

BASIC CLINICAL AND TRANSLATIONAL RESEARCH: Objectives 1. Understand the scope and value of clinical and translational research 2. Understand the basic application of clinical and translational research. Course Components (one required) The University of Rochester Intro to Translational Science Coursera Course OR Harvard Catalyst Fundamentals of Clinical and Translational Science (FaCToR)

SCIENTIFIC COMMUNICATION: Learning Objectives: 1. Understand the purpose and principles of effective scientific communication 2. Define the target audience and tailor a message to specific groups 3. Develop skills in grant writing and scientific writing 4. Develop skills in scientific presentation. Course Components: Grant Writing Workshops, Work-In-Progress Series, Community of Scholars Seminars, Distinguished Speaker Seminars, and Scientific Communication Core Competency Series (5 workshops).

PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT Learning Objectives: 1. Develop skills and knowledge relating to career advancement in clinical and translational science including Leadership, Mentoring, Teaching, Promotion and Tenure, and Team Science. Course Components: Professional Development Workshop Series, Mentor-Protégé Mentoring Workshops, and at least 4 Core Competencies (RCR, Scientific Communication, BERD Bootcamp and one elective)
